translations.value:
In this module, participants will learn:

  1. Which workplace injuries are the most common for drivers.
  2. How these injuries happen.
  3. Techniques to avoid these injuries.

Every year, thousands of workdays are lost due to employee injuries. Workplace injuries are common among trade, transportation and utilities workers. While some workplace injuries are short-term, others may lead to permanent disability or death.

Falls injure many drivers each year. There are two basic types: same-level falls and elevated falls. Generally caused by slips or trips, same-level falls are more common, but elevated falls often cause more severe injuries. Factors that can lead to these injuries include wearing inappropriate footwear, being distracted, carrying materials that obstruct vision, and carelessly entering or exiting vehicles.

Many professional drivers experience sprains or muscle strains, and slips, trips and falls are not the only causes. These injuries can occur when long periods of sitting are followed by short bursts of activity, such as covering a load with a tarp, fueling a truck or manually washing a windshield. Sprains and strains may also happen when drivers climb in or out of their vehicles. These injuries can put a driver out of work for an extended period of time.

Back pain is another concern for drivers. Many drivers sit for long periods of time in a rounded slouch, which can cause back pain. Some drivers are also required to handle heavy objects. Poor posture and poor lifting techniques can lead to painful back injuries.

Many workplace injuries are avoidable if you take the appropriate precautions. Here are some tips to help you avoid common injuries:

  • Pay attention to your surroundings.
  • Wear slip-resistant footwear.
  • Maintain proper posture while driving.
  • Use safe lifting techniques when handling heavy loads.
  • Be careful and aware when entering or exiting vehicles.
Worldwide, more than 900 people die every day from work-related injuries.
Which of the following statements is true?
workdays are lost each year due to employee injuries
workplace injuries are never a concern for professional drivers
workdays are never lost due to employee injuries
workplace injuries do not occur within the transportation industry
Which of the following statements is true?
workplace injuries can result in permanent disability or death
workplace injuries do not occur within the utilities industry
workplace injuries are the concern of employers only
sprains and muscle strains are never avoidable
climbing in or out of a vehicle cannot cause injuries
Which of the following can lead to injuries?
using the steering wheel as support when exiting a vehicle
Which of the following statements is true?
elevated falls always result in exactly the same injuries as same-level falls
elevated falls always result in less serious injuries than same-level falls
elevated falls often cause more severe injuries than same-level falls
elevated falls are the only type of fall that can injure someone
elevated falls are the most common type of fall every year
Which of the following factors can lead to a fall at work?
all of the above are correct
When are drivers especially at risk of sprains and strains?
when they maintain proper posture while driving
when they are involved in short bursts of activity after long periods of sitting
when they refrain from reaching for objects too far from the driver's seat
when they pay attention to their surroundings
Which of the following may cause muscle strains?
all of the above are correct
none of the above are correct
Which of the following statements about sprains and strains is true?
they cannot put a driver out of work for more than 3 days
they can happen when drivers climb in or out of their vehicles
most are caused by drivers relaxing their arms and feet
most help drivers maintain a heightened sense of awareness while changing lanes
all of the above statements are true
Which of the following is a cause of back injuries?
sitting for long periods of time in a rounded slouch
According to the module, what can cause back injuries when drivers handle heavy objects?
overthinking the process of heavy lifting
ensuring a good grip on the object before lifting it
Which of the following statements is true?
all workplace injuries are the fault of employers
all workplace injuries are the fault of employees
frequent workplace injuries are an acceptable part of business
workplace injuries can often be avoided by taking appropriate precautions
drivers should maintain three points of contact with any load they carry
drivers should use a three-point checklist before leaving a parking spot
drivers should maintain three points of contact with the vehicle when entering or exiting it
drivers should use the steering wheel, door, or door handle for support when exiting a vehicle
drivers should count to three to determine their stopping distance
What does using the "three-point rule" do for drivers entering vehicles?
it increases their liability in a fall
it eliminates the company's liability for their safety
it increases their stability and reduces the risk of a fall
it increases their risk of injury in a fall
According to the module, which of the following is safe for a driver to grasp when entering a vehicle?
What should a driver do before exiting a vehicle?
determine a good angle for jumping down
prepare to use the steering wheel for support while climbing down
Which of the following options is the safest way to exit a large truck?
by facing away from the vehicle and stepping forward with both hands free
by facing the vehicle and stepping down backward while holding a fixed object
by using the steering wheel for support while climbing down
by using the door for support while jumping out
Which of the following statements about exiting a large truck is true?
drivers should climb down from the vehicle with their hands full
drivers should carry what they can and toss heavier objects to the ground before exiting
drivers should rest for an hour before climbing down with their hands full
drivers should not climb down from the vehicle with their hands full
all of the above statements are true
What should drivers do with items they need to take with them when they exit a large truck?
carry the items with both hands when exiting
put the items on the floor of the cab and pick them up after exiting
throw items out of the truck and retrieve them from the ground after exiting
arrange items into a sturdy stack and carry the stack with both hands when exiting
hold the items with one hand and jump down to exit the vehicle
Which of the following can cause workplace injuries?
long periods of sitting in a rounded slouch
short bursts of activity after prolonged periods of sitting
all of the above are correct
Which of the following is safe advice for handling heavy objects?
always lift objects manually even when mechanical assistance is available
keep the object as far as possible from your body when carrying it
lift objects while you twist your back
jerk the load several times while you lift
What should you avoid when handling heavy objects?
lifting objects that obscure your vision
keeping objects as close as possible to your body
lifting items from the floor or from above shoulder level
Which of the following should help drivers avoid injuries while handling heavy objects?
having a stable footing and a secure grip
carrying heavy objects as far from the body as possible
taking the shortest route without evaluating it for hazards
lifting everything at one time to complete the task sooner
Which of the following is a common workplace injury for drivers?
Which of the following statements is true?
lifting objects manually is always the best option
it is safer to lift objects from the floor than from waist level
you should lift objects smoothly without twisting your back
improper footwear reduces risks to feet from impacts
all of the above statements are true
How might proper footwear reduce the chances of workplace injuries?
slip-resistant soles help reduce slips and falls
sturdy foot protection reduces risks to feet from impacts and strains
matching colors establish uniformity among employees
